title: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Eclipse, the context for nested classes is not set correctly.
OB: When I have a .java file open in the editor and click the new class button, the field for 'Enclosing Type' is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type (class) that is open in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click on the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard. It should be blank but it should default to the current type in the editor.
